newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Thai Oil shuts 40,000-bpd crude unit for three wks.
newsitem.headline: Thai Oil shuts 40,000-bpd crude unit for three wks.

text.p: Refiner Thai Oil has shut one out of three crude distillation units (CDU) at its 220,000-barrel-per-day (bpd) refinery for three weeks on September 1, a source close to the company said on Tuesday.
The number one CDU has a 40,000-bpd capacity. The refinery is located at the Sri Racha refinery on the country's eastern seaboard.
Trading sources said that due to the shutdown, Thai Oil did not offer any gasoline or middle distillates for export in September.
Thai Oil had exported one 250,000-barrel cargo of 92 to 95 octane unleaded gasoline per month since July, traders said.
The company was earlier offering a 5,000-tonne parcel of jet fuel for lifting during end August.
